intro: Oenothera mandonii, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Oenothera mandonii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
